page.title: 12LANDERMERE MUSIC SCHOOL
page.content: ON SATURDAY MORNINGS DURING TERM TIME THE LANDERMERE JUNIOR MUSIC SCHOOL IS HELD AT TENDRING HIGH SCHOOL JUNIOR SECTION. IT IS RUN BY ESSEX COUNTY COUNCIL AND IS OPEN TO ALL CHILDREN BETWEEN THE AGES OF 10 AND 18. MEMBERS MAY HAVE TUITION ON MOST INSTRUMENTS, STRINGS, WOODWIND AND BRASS, THE MOST POPULAR BEING CLARINET AND FLUTE. IN ADDITION TO INSTRUMENTAL TUITION THERE ARE ALSO LESSONS IN THEORY OF MUSIC AND AURAL. THE STUDENTS MAY TAKE EXAMINATIONS SET BY THE ROYAL SCHOOLS OF MUSIC. THEY ALSO HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO PLAY WITH OTHER MUSICIANS AS THE MUSIC SCHOOL HAS A FULL ORCHESTRA, SENIOR AND JUNIOR STRINGS, CONCERT BAND, JUNIOR WIND BAND AND DANCE BAND. THE MUSIC SCHOOL ORGANISES REGULAR CONCERTS INCLUDING AN ANNUAL ONE IN AID OF THE COMMUNITY ASSOCIATION OF THORPE-LE-SOKEN.
